data.text:
@stefanbar 

As discussed, I propose the following ideas:

1. Only load a portion of the images regardless of how many total images are assigned to a case. 10 or maybe 20. As the user moves through the pages, more images can load in the background. For instance, when the user gets to around 18/20, load the next 20.
2. Show the amount of pages on the screen near the capture counter.
3. If there is more than 300 pages in a case, popup a box that the capturer has to click to remove and continue stating that there is a large number of pages, please check if the document needs to be split.
4. Add a new on hold reason called, Bulk Image Split.
5. The new solution to split images on large cases then can be used to split these cases.

@gillianoberholzer
